comments.author: Mark Miller
comments.body:
bq. Once they make it past a release, they're set in stone..

Why?

comments.author: Steve Rowe
comments.body: I searched just now, but couldn't find, an email thread I recall on java-dev between Doug Cutting and the RM at that point (several years ago) about modifying past releases' CHANGES.txt entries.  Doug's position, articulated both in that thread (and elsewhere, IIRC), was that people depend on being able to do a diff between CHANGES.txt versions, so once a release was cut, the release notes should never change thereafter.

comments.author: Mark Miller
comments.body:
interesting - someone forgot to put up the sign ;) I've posted a back spell fix before that was applied (wasn't me ;) it was before someone was nuts enough to give me write access to Lucene) 

Thanks a lot for the patch - you've got some eagle eyes man - I wouldn't have caught those name misspellings.

comments.author: Mark Miller
comments.body: hmm - got marked invalid - weird - reopen to resolve right

description:
I noticed a few typos in CHANGES.txt and contrib/CHANGES.txt.  (Once they make it past a release, they're set in stone...)

Will attach a patch shortly.
summary: Fix typos in CHANGES.txt and contrib/CHANGES.txt prior to 2.9 release
